intro: Simbuleta elata, commonly known as the tall simbuleta, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its erect, woody stems and large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
